text: The 36th Australian Film Institute Awards (generally known as the AFI Awards) were held in 1994. Presented by the Australian Film Institute (AFI), the awards celebrated the best in Australian feature film, television, documentary and short film productions of the year. ==Feature film== {| class=wikitable style="width="100%" |- ! style="background:#C4C3D0;width:50%" | Best Film !style="background:#C4C3D0;width:50%" | Best Direction |- | valign="top" | *Muriel's Wedding – Lynda House, Jocelyn Moorhouse **Bad Boy Bubby – Rolf de Heer, Giorgio Draskovic, Domenico Procacci **The Adventures Of Priscilla, Queen Of The Desert – Al Clark, Michael Hamlyn, Rebel Penfold-Russell **The Sum of Us – Hal McElroy | valign="top" | *Rolf de Heer – Bad Boy Bubby **Alkinos Tsilimidos – Everynight ... Everynight **P.J. Hogan – Muriel's Wedding **Stephan Elliott – The Adventures Of Priscilla, Queen Of The Desert |- ! style="background:#C4C3D0;width:50%" | Best Actor in a Leading Role ! style="background:#C4C3D0;width:50%" | Best Actress in a Leading Role |- | valign="top" | *Nicholas Hope – Bad Boy Bubby **John Hargreaves – Country Life **Hugo Weaving – The Adventures of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert **Terence Stamp – The Adventures of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert | valign="top" | *Toni Collette – Muriel's Wedding **Kerry Fox – Country Life **Tara Fitzgerald – Sirens **Victoria Longley – Talk |- ! style="background:#C4C3D0;width:50%" | Best Actor in a Supporting Role ! style="background:#C4C3D0;width:50%" | Best Actress in a Supporting Role |- | valign="top" | *Max Cullen – Spider & Rose **Bill Hunter – Muriel's Wedding **John Polson – The Sum of Us **Kiet Lam – Traps | valign="top" | *Rachel Griffiths – Muriel's Wedding **Jeanie Drynan – Muriel's Wedding **Deborah Kennedy – The Sum of Us **Jacqueline McKenzie – Traps |- ! style="background:#C4C3D0;width:50%" | Best Original Screenplay ! style="background:#C4C3D0;width:50%" | Best Adapted Screenplay |- | valign="top" | *Rolf de Heer – Bad Boy Bubby **P.J. Hogan – Muriel's Wedding **Kym Goldsworthy – The Roly Poly Man **Stephan Elliott – The Adventures of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert | valign="top" | *David Stevens – The Sum of Us **Michael Blakemore – Country Life **Ray Mooney, Alkinos Tsilimidos – Everynight ... style="background:#C4C3D0;width:50%" | Best Production Design ! style="background:#C4C3D0;width:50%" | Best Costume Design |- | valign="top" | *Owen Paterson – The Adventures of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert **Chris Kennedy – Gino **Paddy Reardon – Muriel's Wedding **Michael Philips – Traps | valign="top" | *Lizzy Gardiner, Tim Chappel – The Adventures of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert **Anna Borghesi – Body Melt **Wendy Chuck – Country Life **Terry Ryan – Muriel's Wedding |} ==Additional awards== {| class=wikitable style="width="100%" |- ! style="background:#C4C3D0;width:50%" | Best Achievement in Sound in a Non-Feature Film ! style="background:#C4C3D0;width:50%" | Open Craft Award |- | valign="top" | *Greg Fitzgerald, Peter Johnson, Andrew Lancaster – Universal Appliance Company **Bronwyn Murphy, Ronnie Reinhard, Peter Walker – Aeroplane Dance **Steve Best, Ian Sherry, Peter Sullivan – The Last Magician **Craig Carter, James Currie, Gretchen Thornburn – The Sewing Room **Michael Gissing, Peter Miller, Leo Sullivan – Watch The Watch | valign="top" | *Elena Mandalis (for performance) – Only The Brave **Joshua Yeldham (for innovation in form) – Frailejon **Rey Carlson, Anna Grieve, James Manche (for art direction) – Pram Factory **Tracey Holloway, Liz Thompson (for direction) – The Last Magician |} ==See also== * List of Australian films of 1993 * List of Australian films of 1994 ==References== ==External links== * The Australian Film Institute | Australian Academy of Cinema and Television Arts official website Category:AACTA Awards ceremonies AACTA Awards Category:1994 in Australian cinema
